name: ScheduleCampaignDelivery
description:
Schedule a Mailchimp campaign for delivery.

Use this tool to schedule a Mailchimp campaign for delivery. Ideal for standard campaigns; for Multivariate or RSS campaigns, consider using the send action instead.

parameters.name: campaign_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Mailchimp campaign to be scheduled.

value_schema.description: The unique id for the campaign.

parameters.name: schedule_delivery_time
parameters.description: The UTC date and time to schedule the campaign for delivery in ISO 8601 format. Must be on the quarter-hour (:00, :15, :30, :45).

value_schema.description: The UTC date and time to schedule the campaign for delivery in ISO 8601 format. Campaigns may only be scheduled to send on the quarter-hour (:00, :15, :30, :45).

parameters.name: batch_delivery_delay
parameters.description: The delay in minutes between batches for campaign delivery.

value_schema.description: The delay, in minutes, between batches.

parameters.name: number_of_batches_for_campaign
parameters.description: The number of batches for the campaign send. Determines how the campaign delivery is split into batches.

value_schema.description: The number of batches for the campaign send.

parameters.name: use_timewarp
parameters.description: Set to true to use Timewarp for localizing campaign delivery to recipients' time zones. Cannot be true when using Batch Delivery.

value_schema.description: Choose whether the campaign should use [Timewarp](https://mailchimp.com/help/use-timewarp/) when sending. Campaigns scheduled with Timewarp are localized based on the recipients' time zones. For example, a Timewarp campaign with a `schedule_time` of 13:00 will be sent to each recipient at 1:00pm in their local time. Cannot be set to `true` for campaigns using [Batch Delivery](https://mailchimp.com/help/schedule-batch-delivery/).
